TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Int64Converter extends System.ComponentModel.BaseNumberConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert 64-bit signed integer objects to and from various other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert a 64-bit signed integer object to and from a string. The <xref:System.Int64> value type represents integers with values ranging from negative 9,223,372,036,854,775,808 through positive 9,223,372,036,854,775,807.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method uses the <xref:System.Int64.Parse%2A> method of <xref:System.Int64> with the integer value of <xref:System.Globalization.NumberStyles>.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.ConvertTo%2A> method uses the general ("G") format for the string returned.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of an <xref:System.ComponentModel.Int64Converter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
## Examples The following sample converts a variable of type <xref:System.Int64> to a string, and vice versa.
[!code-cpp[Converters#16](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/CPP/converters.cpp#16)] [!code-csharp[Converters#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/CS/converters.cs#16)] [!code-vb[Converters#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/VB/converters.vb#16)]
